result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontez C. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
**Pay DNA surcharge.  May Not have contact with drug dealers or users.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontez C. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions, consecutive to 11CF3251; pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney E King.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 6/26/14 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 5-14-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared by Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Def. does not appear. Atty. King indicates def. is in Milwaukee Secure Det. Fac. and the State must writ him. Time limits tolled due to unavailability of def. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 4-29-14 @ 9:30am. State to prepare writ for def. Bond continued.

221pm  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chuck Bennett.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/10/14 @ 830am.  Atty. Bennett moves to dismiss complaint for lack of probable cause.  Court denies motion.  $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/UW-Parkside Campus
961.41(1m)(h)1 - Poss w/intent to deliv THC repeater
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
